overview:
This class allows you interact with Cloud Video Intelligence.

First, install @google-cloud/video-intelligence with npm:

$ npm install --save @google-cloud/video-intelligence

If you are running your app on Google Compute Engine, you won't need to worry about supplying connection configuration options to @google-cloud/video-intelligenceâ€” we figure that out for you.

However, if you're running your app elsewhere, you will need to provide project details to authenticate API requests.

Google Cloud Platform

var video = require('@google-cloud/video-intelligence')();

Elsewhere

var video = require('@google-cloud/video-intelligence')({ projectId: 'grape-spaceship-123', keyFilename: '/path/to/keyfile.json' });

The full set of options which can be passed to @google-cloud/video-intelligence are outlined in our Authentication guide.

methods.name: VideoIntelligenceServiceClient
methods.description: Service that implements Google Cloud Video Intelligence API.

methods.name: getProjectId
methods.description: Get the project ID used by this class.

params.name: callback
params.description: • the callback to be called with the current project Id.

methods.name: annotateVideo
methods.description: Performs asynchronous video annotation. Progress and results can be retrieved through the google.longrunning.Operations interface. Operation.metadata contains AnnotateVideoProgress (progress). Operation.response contains AnnotateVideoResponse (results).

params.name: request
params.description: The request object that will be sent.

params.name: request.inputUri
params.description: Input video location. Currently, only Google Cloud Storage URIs are supported, which must be specified in the following format: gs://bucket-id/object-id (other URI formats return {@link google.rpc.Code.INVALID_ARGUMENT}). For more information, see Request URIs. A video URI may include wildcards in object-id, and thus identify multiple videos. Supported wildcards: '*' to match 0 or more characters; '?' to match 1 character. If unset, the input video should be embedded in the request as input_content. If set, input_content should be unset.

params.name: request.features
params.description:
Requested video annotation features.

The number should be among the values of Feature Feature

params.name: request.inputContent
params.description: The video data bytes. Encoding: base64. If unset, the input video(s) should be specified via input_uri. If set, input_uri should be unset.

params.name: request.videoContext
params.description:
Additional video context and/or feature-specific parameters.

This object should have the same structure as VideoContext VideoContext

params.name: request.outputUri
params.description: Optional location where the output (in JSON format) should be stored. Currently, only Google Cloud Storage URIs are supported, which must be specified in the following format: gs://bucket-id/object-id (other URI formats return {@link google.rpc.Code.INVALID_ARGUMENT}). For more information, see Request URIs.

params.name: request.locationId
params.description: Optional cloud region where annotation should take place. Supported cloud regions: us-east1, us-west1, europe-west1, asia-east1. If no region is specified, a region will be determined based on video file location.

params.name: options
params.description: Optional parameters. You can override the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout, retries, paginations, etc. See gax.CallOptions for the details.

params.name: callback
params.description:
The function which will be called with the result of the API call.

The second parameter to the callback is a gax.Operation object.

returns.description: • The promise which resolves to an array. The first element of the array is a gax.Operation object. The promise has a method named "cancel" which cancels the ongoing API call.

params.name: opts.servicePath
params.description: The domain name of the API remote host.

params.name: opts.port
params.description: The port on which to connect to the remote host.

params.name: opts.sslCreds
params.description: A ClientCredentials for use with an SSL-enabled channel.

params.name: opts.clientConfig
params.description: The customized config to build the call settings. See {@link gax.constructSettings} for the format.
